author: bridge-bot
content:
<KamilChNethermind> @notnotstorm_p @FunnyGiulio @amezianehamlat @vdWijden <@316280621783580673> 

For interop I'd need you to create a branch to which you will be pushing any experimental performance fixes for scenarios found during the performance testing.
Having that we can build docker images on commit to this branch and use the in all our environments to give you a fastest possible feedback loop if fixes are actually improving something and do not cause any regressions elsewhere.

If you can do that asap would be amazing so we can set it up with docker builds fast for both perfnet and op-codes benchmarks.

author: bridge-bot
content:
<shekhirin> re: **@shekhirin**
> can you run Reth with --engine.precompile-cache argument?
to confirm, are you currently running Reth with `--engine.precompile-cache` flag?

author: bridge-bot
content:

op-codes tests are also without this flag - shall I add it?

author: bridge-bot
content: <shekhirin> we will create a branch that will have this flag enabled by default
